Rectosigmoidoscopy/colonoscopy: to visualise suggestive lesions (pseudomembranes of C difficile colitis) and take biopsies.

Indications: persistent diarrhoea with no identified cause despite the work-up described above, or in cases of immunodepression with no identified aetiology for the diarrhoea.

Endoscopic examination is rarely indicated in children and is subject to specialist paediatric advice.

properties.question: What are the indications for endoscopic examination (rectosigmoidoscopy/colonoscopy) in patients with persistent diarrhoea?
properties.option_a: Acute gastroenteritis with clear resolution within a few days
properties.option_b: Persistent diarrhoea with no identified cause after initial work-up
properties.option_c: Short-term diarrhoea associated with food intake
properties.option_d: Immunodepression with a known cause for diarrhoea
